Stormcaller The hurricane battered me with a ferocity beyond any foe I had met, battered harder than the roiling chaos in my mind that drove me here, to the ends of the system, in search of— - - “Calm,” whispered the Voidwalker. “Burn!” roared the Sunsinger. All I could hear was the impassive voices of my teachers, encouraging me (ordering me?) to find my path, find it soon, no matter the risk, because we can never know when it will all be taken away again, when the storm will overtake us. Words, buffeting me like the hail that pelted my face as I pushed through the howling winds, forced my way through to the eye of— - - Peace. - - The stillness of the hurricane's eye prickled my skin and brought with it realization. We don't have to choose between the calm and the storm. In fact, to have either, we must have both. - - That was the day I first called the storm.

He wanted to bring down great beasts, not assassinate old Cabal aristocrats. - - "Oh, Rull. Don't fret. I promised you a warrior's paradise and you shall have it. Gensym Knight Eris, - I have scoured my library but found nothing on this “Nokris” of which you speak. I am sorry both for the delay and that I could not be of more help. Takanome Wings The City's first protectors were Ayane Takanome and her Rangers. - - In the darkest days, we didn't have many Guardians. And those who Ghosts had revived were scattered across the solar system, far from the people who needed protection as they made their way to the City in the Traveler's shadow. - - From their perches high up in the mountains, the Takanome Rangers guarded the refugee roads to the City. Their rifles brought down many Fallen, as well as human bandits and murderers. - - But Rangers only had one life to give. When they died, they were gone forever. So the Takanome Rangers took to planting blue flowers along the roads they watched. That way, when they fell, a piece of them would live on to guide weary travelers home. - —Chiyoko Mey, Daito President

Io Treasure Map "The lead I got from Asher was some Psion was seen making off with this one somewhere in the Echo Mesa. He mumbled something about it being on top of some Cabal checkpoint, before it—well—fell into a pit of Taken. And we all know how that turns out." —Cayde-6
Io Treasure Map "You ever talk to Banshee much? He's got this saying: Sometime the deeper you go, the less you'll ever understand. The Cabal are kind of like that. Why they feel the need to drag my stuff into their damn Io base… beyond me." —Cayde-6
Io Treasure Map "OK, another live cache report here… Gotta give the Cabal credit. They're great at digging tunnels. Then again, so are worms… and snakes… and woodchucks… and crabs... and ants… ugh, I hate ants." —Cayde-6
Io Treasure Map "OK, so, Albios's memorial service was on Io. Sacred to Warlocks, blah blah blah. Don't get me wrong, I liked Al—but the service ran a bit long. Ended up betting Banshee I could make a few hairy jumps high up on the Mesa. Broke both my legs, but I did it. I forget what Banshee gave me, but I know I left it in a cache up there somewhere.” —Cayde-6
Io Treasure Map "So word is one of the Cabal's drill engineers found another one of my caches. I don't know if I did such a good job sealing it or if those dumb rhino fingers are too fat to pry it open. Anyway, it's been spotted in some hole near that drill site. I guess Ghaul called them back before they could get into it." —Cayde-6

EDZ Treasure Map "Listen, I feel bad making you go after my stuff, so last night I snuck down to the EDZ. Sh-sh-sh, don't tell Zavala! Anyway, I got the cache, then got a tiny bit turned around and ended up in a Cabal base. You know how that is. The dogs and all. Had to stash the goods quickly and get out. So… can you go get it?” —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "Stashed plenty of loot up at the old mill in the EDZ. To scare the Dregs off, I'd throw on some old Festival of the Lost masks and make 'em think the place was haunted." —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map “Good news: I remember exactly where one of my old EDZ caches is. Bad news: those parts are Taken territory now. So I guess the question is: how bad d'you want it?”
EDZ Treasure Map "New lead from Hawthorne. Not really much to go on, something about a fan. I know I must have a lot of them, so if you see one down in the EDZ, maybe ask them?" —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "They thought they had me dead-to-sights… backing me down this cliff. But I could see some fellow Hunters sparrowing in from the highway. Classic. So I sparked up a little Golden Gun and bought my guys some time. I know I dropped something good in that one." —Cayde-6

Nessus Treasure Map "So this cache… I don't know. It seemed like a good idea at the time. How do you feel about climbing trees?" —Cayde-6
Nessus Treasure Map "So down I went. I thought maybe the deeper it got, the better access I would have to their core Mind or Nexus points. I do read Ikora's Vex reports. Sometimes. Anyway, found nothing but roots." —Cayde-6
Nessus Treasure Map "I guess I was afraid that Mind juice would somehow seize control of my weapons or something. That stuff isn't some kind of luxurious milk bath, trust me." —Cayde-6
Nessus Treasure Map "I was just doing what Failsafe said. I mean, she seems reliable, half the time. So I entered this cave and set up my little fallback point, took a few steps in, and bam, the battle began." —Cayde-6
Nessus Treasure Map "One point, I thought I'd broken free, so I made a break for a path through a tangle of roots. Caught sight of the cache and then bam, I was back in the loop again." —Cayde-6
Nessus Treasure Map "Of course, I didn't go charging into Nessus without a plan. I made sure I had caches everywhere. Started with the first dead Vex construct I found." —Cayde-6
Nessus Treasure Map "I don't know what they call it. The eyeball thing. Under that. You'll know it when you see it." —Cayde-6
Nessus Treasure Map "It was like I was being called closer, like something wanted my help. Then I get to this tower with a triangular doorway and go through. That's when it got really weird." —Cayde-6
Nessus Treasure Map "I wonder if the Vex even realize I hide stuff between the gaps in their block networks. Hmmm. Maybe that's how they know so much about me." —Cayde-6
Nessus Treasure Map "Good news: I left myself a reminder note for this cache! Bad news: the note says ‘Whatever you do, under any circumstances, do not look down.' That's enough to go on, right?”

Titan Treasure Map "Getting pings on another one somewhere high up in one of those towers. From what I hear, the Fallen are using those towers as some kind of junkyard. Could be like a needle in a haystack. Good luck.” —Cayde-6

Titan Treasure Map "So I chased the gang of Awoken thieves up to the Arcology. That bridge didn't look too stable, and I'm not into methane baths, so I stashed what I had and picked up their trail inside." —Cayde-6
Titan Treasure Map "Titan who gave me the lead said he stood there watching their spawning crud just repel off my cache… too scared to touch it. You aren't scared of a little Hive fungus are you?" —Cayde-6

Titan Treasure Map "Those Fallen on Titan. I've been after them for years. They ransacked an old trove I kept in the Sink on Venus, then went completely dark. Getting pings on one, but everyone who's been after it gets lost in the dark way down below." —Cayde-6
Titan Treasure Map "You know what I used to love about my rest stops on Titan? Walking into the Arcology and thinking about it in its heyday. But then you get to thinking of how much we actually lost, and now the Hive just spawning everywhere… and the will to fight boils right back up." —Cayde-6

EDZ Treasure Map "OK, all I can give you to go on in this one is… it's high up. So… look up, I guess? Don't look at me like that, I'm doing my best.” —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "I've been all around this system, seen all sorts of transports, but nothing with the resiliency of this old Golden Age rustbucket I found in the EDZ. Used it as a grab-and-go spot for years." —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "I used to have this old lookout. Scoped out my first FWC bunker there. Just like the Cabal to plop that eyesore of a base right on top of a piece of dark age nostalgia. Do me a favor, if you make it up there: snipe a few rhinos for me." —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "I tell you what. You get to work cleaning out the angry spider-pirates and space-rhinos, and I give you the deed to this little cabin I won from Ren. With a little work, could become a nice little getaway." —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "So I took off edging the cliff, Golden Gun down to one shot. Left a lot behind cliffside. Bad day." —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "So after a full day of pulling loot out of the Fallen's hands, I thought I would just cool my engines down by that old river, but as soon as I cached it all up down there, a Servitor shows up." —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "You know, I used to think if it's marked a dead zone, it's my kind of place. Vanguard cured me of that, but I left plenty behind there back in the day. Third-floor balcony, above the alley. Loved that spot…. Hope the Fallen haven't got to it." —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "You do much driving? Me neither. But I used to spend nights hiding out near this truck just teetering on a ledge, just waiting for the day some dumb Dreg would send it over the ledge. That day never came." —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "This place is full of old containers. Don't bother raiding them all—I already did. They're all filled with shoes. Mountains of Golden Age footwear, and not a thing in my size." —Cayde-6
EDZ Treasure Map "So once you get up there, don't be afraid to strut it on the catwalk. We both know the importance of looking good." —Cayde-6

Io Treasure Map "I got word on another cache in the Echo Mesa. Some of Asher's 'assistants' chased a Legionary out of the Cabal Base but lost him in a little cave nearby. Must've left it there, since the rhino came out empty handed. That's when the assistants got him. Good thing, 'cause I'd rather it go to you." —Cayde-6
Io Treasure Map "You know Eris Morn, right? Creepy three-eyed old Hunter, too much foundation? Doesn't matter. She comes in and asks me how Io was and I say, wrong Vanguard, ask Ikora; and she's like, I was hoping that cache by the bones marked your grave; and I'm like, I'm an Exo, I left my bones behind a long time ago; and she goes, exactly. You get anything from that?" —Cayde-6
Io Treasure Map "Have you ever had a dream you're in this cave full of mist and you see this amazing cache, but every time you reach to open it, a new layer of mists blocks your path? No? Am I the only one who has this dream?" —Cayde-6
Io Treasure Map "When I was caught in that Vex Teleporter, I would end up in weird places. Once or twice, I swear it was Io and saw one of my own caches on top one of those tall, pointy Vex things. That's all I got for you. That ‘porter was not a fun time!” —Cayde-6
Io Treasure Map "Funny thing, I know I've been to Io, but all the details are pretty hazy. Guess I'm getting old. I have this memory of a battle on a bridge. Vex everywhere. After crossing a bridge, we took cover to the right, and then, well, it gets fuzzy from there. Maybe worth checking out?" —Cayde-6

./world_stuff\DestinyPlaceDefinition.json

Name Description Icon
The Almighty Dominus Ghaul's superweapon. A vessel capable of destroying stars.
Orbit In orbit
Nessus An unstable Centaur planetoid.
Earth Mankind's cradle, full of shattered glory, ready to be reclaimed.
The Crucible Hone your skills and win glory in battle against other Guardians.
Io A moon of Jupiter, and the last place the Traveler touched before the Collapse.
Nessus Orbit The Emperor's Flagship
Titan, Moon of Saturn A moon of Saturn once settled by humanity in its Golden Age.
Strike Playlist Join a fireteam of three and face the most feared minions of the Darkness.
Unknown Space The Nine have sent an Emissary to test Guardians.
Mercury Sun-baked Mercury was transformed by the Traveler - and the Vex.

Faster Cooldown This vehicle has a shorter cooldown between summonings.
MIDA Multi-Tool MIDA MULTI-TOOL - Boosts move speed.
Ghost Blue Adds a blue Ghost ring to your transmat effects.
Fallen Arrival Adds a Fallen Servitor appearance to your transmat effects.
Opening Shot Improved accuracy and range on the opening shot of attack.
Titan Glimmer Scavenger Increase Glimmer gains by 10% on the moon of Titan.
Void Effects Adds Void elements to your transmat effects.
Defensive Strike Kill an enemy with this melee ability to create an overshield around you and nearby allies.
Burst Guard Sword Guard has low efficiency and high defense.
High-Impact Frame HIGH IMPACT - Long range, slow-firing, and high-damage.
Target Acquired When Personal Assistant is active, this weapon has better target acquisition and deals more precision damage.
Heavy Warlock Armor HEAVY WARLOCK ARMOR - Improved resilience.
Clarion Call: Clans Hawthorne has issued a Clarion Call. Experience gain increased while playing wtih clanmates.
Well-Rested XP gains increased by 3x for your first 3 Levels this week.
Vermin Reloading immediately after a kill grants a brief period of invisibility.
Clarion Call: Warlocks Ikora Rey has issued a Clarion Call. Experience gain increased for Warlocks.
Actual Grandeur ACTUAL GRANDEUR - Provides additional damage resistance during Nova Bomb. Nova Bomb kills grant Super energy.
Conduction Tines CONDUCTION TINES - Arc ability kills increase the recharge rate of your Arc abilities.

Abyssal Extractors ABYSSAL EXTRACTORS - Void-damage kills increase ability energy recharge rate.
Dead Orbit Supporter You've pledged loyalty to Dead Orbit in this Faction Rally.
Vex Arrival Adds a Vex storm appearance to your transmat effects.
Shock Blast SHOCK BLAST - Fires high-damage Arc blast.
Destabilizers Use while airborne to release roll stabilizers, and to roll.
Dynamic Sway Reduction When holding down the trigger, this weapon's sway-reduction system boosts accuracy over time.
Rat Pack RAT PACK - Nearby Rat Kings increase strength.
Arc Weapon Analyzer Generate Gunsmith telemetry data on Arc weapon kills.
XP Boost Increases experience gains for your Subclass, Weapons, and Armor.
Air Control This vehicle gains increased agility while airborne.
Precision Frame PRECISION - Fires a long-range precision energy bolt.
Crucible Blue Adds a blue Crucible crest to your transmat effects.
Headseeker Body shots landed with this weapon increase precision damage for a short time.
Strike Paragon A member of your fireteam has used a Bright Medallion, granting all members of the fireteam increased XP gains and loot from strike completion.
Arc Ability Module Class abilities recharge faster when using an Arc subclass.
Firmly Planted Increased accuracy, stability, and handling when firing while crouched.
Solar Impact Accelerator Solar melee abilities recharge faster.
Tap the Trigger Grants a short period of increased stability and accuracy on initial trigger pull.
Void Impact Accelerator Void melee abilities recharge faster.

Guardian Oath You've sworn to uphold Guardian ideals and work as a team to defeat your enemies. - - Leaving your team will make you an Oath Breaker.
Icarus Dash Activate while midair to dodge.
Autoloader This vehicle reloads weapons while you ride.

./world_stuff\DestinySocketCategoryDefinition.json

Name Description Icon
Vehicle Perks Perks are built into a given Sparrow or Jumpship. They cannot be swapped out.
ARMOR PERKS Perks are built into a given piece of armor. They can be swapped out an unlimited number of times.
WEAPON MODS Attach a mod to a weapon to improve or add to its perks. Doing so consumes the mod.
GHOST SHELL PERKS Perks are built into a given Ghost Shell. They can be swapped out an unlimited number of times.
GHOST SHELL MODS Attach a mod to a Ghost Shell to improve or add to its perks. Doing so consumes the mod.
Clan Perks Clan Perks are enabled when you belong to a clan that has reached the indicated clan level for that season.
Clan Staves Staves are rewarded for reaching the maximum clan level each season.
WEAPON PERKS Perks are built in to a given weapon. They can be swapped out an unlimited number of times.
VEHICLE MODS Attach a mod to a Sparrow or Jumpship to improve or add to its perks. Doing so consumes the mod.
VEHICLE MODS Attach a mod to a Sparrow or Jumpship to improve or add to its perks. Doing so consumes the mod.
ARMOR MODS Attach a mod to a piece of armor to improve or add to its perks. Doing so consumes the mod.

./world_stuff\DestinySocketTypeDefinition.json

Name Description Icon

./world_stuff\DestinyStatDefinition.json

Name Description Icon
Velocity Increases the speed of projectiles fired by this weapon.
Recoil Direction The weapon's tendency to move while firing.
Efficiency Ammo lost when guarding with this weapon.
Swing Speed The speed at which you can launch attacks.
Charge Time The time in milliseconds before a weapon fires.
Mobility Increases your movement speed and maximum jump height.
Boost How much speed can be gained from boosting.
Zoom How much the weapon's scope can zoom in on targets.
Precision Damage Damage when striking a target's weak points.
Blast Radius Increases the explosion radius of this weapon.
Magazine The number of shots which can be fired before reloading.
Defense Reduces incoming damage from your enemies.
Move Speed Speed while carrying the weapon.
Time to Aim Down Sights Speed while aiming down the sights.
Impact Increases the damage inflicted by each round.
Reload Speed The time it takes to reload this weapon.
Strength Strength reduces the cooldown time of your melee ability, allowing you to use it more often. - - Find and equip armor with Strength to boost this effect.
Rounds Per Minute The number of shots per minute this weapon can fire.
Intellect Decreases the cooldown of your Super ability, allowing you to use it more often. - - Find and equip armor with Strength to boost this effect.
Stability How much or little recoil you will experience while firing the weapon.
Defense Damage reduction while guarding with this weapon.
Durability Higher Durability allows your vehicle to take more damage before failing.
Resilience Increases the amount of damage you can take before dying.
Ammo Capacity How many powerful attacks this weapon can launch before ammo is depleted
Handling The speed with which the weapon can be readied and aimed.
Range Increases the effective range of this weapon.
Aim Assistance The weapon's ability to augment your aim.
Attack Higher Attack allows your weapons to damage higher-level opponents.
Speed How fast this vehicle travels over land.
Discipline Discipline decreases the cooldown time of your grenades, allowing you to use them more often. - - Find and equip armor with Discipline to boost this effect.
Inventory Size How much space the weapon occupies in the inventory.
Power Raising your Power increases the damage your abilities deal against higher-level enemies.
Recovery Increases the speed at which you regain lost health.
